timeline.message: Update README for extensions propagators for #2067.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe "Lightstep OpenTracing" here, rather than just "OpenTracing"?
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5,3 +5,18 @@ OpenTelemetry Contrib Trace Propagators
 
 [javadoc-image]: https://www.javadoc.io/badge/io.opentelemetry/opentelemetry-contrib-trace-propagators.svg
 [javadoc-url]: https://www.javadoc.io/doc/io.opentelemetry/opentelemetry-contrib-trace-propagators
+
+This project contains [trace propagators](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/context/api-propagators.md) that support
+3rd-party propagation formats.  These propagators are here for convenience and are not officially
+supported by the OpenTelemetry Java maintainers.
+
+Issues/support for these propagators is only provided as a minimal "best effort", and critical
+bugs should be filed with the respective vendors themselves.
+
+* AWS X-Ray (file an issue here and mention @anuraaga)
+* OpenTracing (file an issue here and mention @carlosalberto)

timeline.bodyText: I thought we were on the hook to support these 2. Has that changed?
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5,3 +5,18 @@ OpenTelemetry Contrib Trace Propagators
 
 [javadoc-image]: https://www.javadoc.io/badge/io.opentelemetry/opentelemetry-contrib-trace-propagators.svg
 [javadoc-url]: https://www.javadoc.io/doc/io.opentelemetry/opentelemetry-contrib-trace-propagators
+
+This project contains [trace propagators](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/context/api-propagators.md) that support
+3rd-party propagation formats.  These propagators are here for convenience and are not officially
+supported by the OpenTelemetry Java maintainers.
+
+Issues/support for these propagators is only provided as a minimal "best effort", and critical
+bugs should be filed with the respective vendors themselves.
+
+* AWS X-Ray (file an issue here and mention @anuraaga)
+* OpenTracing (file an issue here and mention @carlosalberto)
+* B3 (file an issue on [the OpenZipkin repo](https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation) that points here)
+* Jaeger (file an issue on [the Jaeger repo](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger) that points here)

replies.bodyText: I think that's up to us to decide...but the discussion in #2067 led me to believe that this entire subproject was external/contrib/3rd party.  If these are first-class supported exporters, should we move them into the main codebase?
replies.author: breedx-splk

replies.bodyText: I would very much prefer if we weren't having to support these propagators, but it's unclear to me whether these are considered 1st-class or 3rd-party or somewhere in between.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I put a note in the SIG agenda for Wed. about the TraceMultiPropagator, so maybe we can figure this out then too?
replies.author: breedx-splk

replies.bodyText:
It's pretty explicit that they are official
https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/84d2b533eb7f1120b476b2ba7f301e467c890304/specification/context/api-propagators.md#propagators-distribution
Natural too since without them, no one can migrate to OpenTelemetry :P I think B3 and Jaeger were here in this package without much consideration to who supports them, more just something like "why not keep all the propagators together". But we're definitely on the hook for them.
I'd be ok with moving those into opentelemetry-api-trace if the wording here would make the OTel support aspect convoluted.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I'll change the wording here and will file a separate issue for moving B3 and Jaeger to opentelemetry-api-trace to be peers of W3CTraceContextPropagator.
replies.author: breedx-splk

replies.bodyText: FYI, still not sure where this is going to land:  open-telemetry/oteps#142 and whether it applies to propagators or not, and what set of propagators.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * ListStep OpenTracing (file an issue here and mention @carlosalberto)
          
          
            
            * LightStep OpenTracing (file an issue here and mention @carlosalberto)
timeline.author: anuraaga
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5,3 +5,18 @@ OpenTelemetry Contrib Trace Propagators
 
 [javadoc-image]: https://www.javadoc.io/badge/io.opentelemetry/opentelemetry-contrib-trace-propagators.svg
 [javadoc-url]: https://www.javadoc.io/doc/io.opentelemetry/opentelemetry-contrib-trace-propagators
+
+This project contains [trace propagators](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/context/api-propagators.md) that support
+3rd-party propagation formats.  These propagators are here for convenience and are not officially
+supported by the OpenTelemetry Java maintainers.
+
+Issues/support for these propagators is only provided as a minimal "best effort", and critical
+bugs should be filed with the respective vendors themselves.
+
+* AWS X-Ray (file an issue here and mention @anuraaga)
+* ListStep OpenTracing (file an issue here and mention @carlosalberto)

timeline.message: b3 and jaeger are supported here.
